results.title: Cray season
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian State Film Unit and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: The crayfish, seen not as a table delicacy, but as a living creature whose survival is threatened. Briefly looks at its life history, its vulnerability, its predators, and man its greatest enemy. Feild researchers take the camera underwater to the world of ‘Janus Lalander’, the southern crayfish.

results.title: Crash zone
results.creator_credit: Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Crash Zone is the place where the five friends, Mike, Pi, Marcello, Bec and Ram go to test drive the games. Combining technological fact and fantasy with issues such as friendship, teamwork and loyalty, the series follows the exciting online and real-life adventures of the friends.

constellations_other.name: Television and creative constraint
constellations_other.description: Making art for the screen is dependent on time, resources, and infrastructure. Where technology could have posed a barrier, these television producers saw an opportunity, instead.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children’s Television Foundation
results.description: Television series aimed at pre and young teens about a group of kids who land the after-school job of their dreams, testing computer games. The Crash Zone is the place where the five friends, Mike, Pi, Marcello, Bec and Ram go to test drive the games created by Alexandra Davis, owner of the software company Catalyst, before they go on the market. Combining technological fact and fantasy with issues such as friendship, teamwork and loyalty, the series follows the exciting online and real-life adventures of the friends, who range in age from 11-16. Although aimed at 9 to 13 year olds, “Crash Zone” is thought provoking and appealing to all age levels and can be used to encourage discussion about cultural, social, philosophic and technological issues related to ‘new media’, information systems and the rights of individuals in a ‘networked world’. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash (E)
results.brief_description: Based on J.G. Ballard’s controversial novel, “Crash” is a highly erotic film about an advertising executive (James Spader) who finds himself aroused by the imagery of car wrecks after surviving a car accident. He soon finds himself involved in a secret society in which disability and damaged limbs are fetishised and in which the sex act is most venerated the closest it comes to approximating death. Cronenberg’s cinema of horror has always focused on our secret fears and terrors about our own bodies. Ballard’s novel was about an all too recognisable dystopia where the automobile rules and in which the human body has become secondary to the mobility and mechanical perfection of the automobile. The combination of these two artist’s temperament has resulted in a motion picture which is at its most sexual the closer it gets to an audiences primal fears about speed and technology. Though controversial and confronting, the film is also undeniably exciting and visually mesmerising. With Holly Hunter, Elias Koteas, Rosanna Arquette and Deborah Kara Unger.

results.title: Cranwell: the Royal Air Force College
results.creator_credit: Ian Latimer, Rank Organisation Short Films Group and David Eady
results.brief_description: Eighteen thousand new officers are commissioned annually into the R.A.F. Those who come from the Cranwell Royal Air Force College set an especially high standard. Cadets are trained as pilots and navigators and for the specialist branches - Technical, Secretarial, Equipment, and the R.A.F. Regiment. Great emphasis is placed on leaderhship in all branches, and on the high quality instruction. Cadets commissioned from Cromwell have every chance of getting to the top.

results.title: Crane Island
results.creator_credit: Leonard Frost, ONF | NFB and Raymond Garceau
results.brief_description: A visit to one of the many tiny islands in the St. Lawrence River. Flocks of snow geese and other migratory birds, annually attract hundreds of sportsmen. Accompanies a party of visiting hunters as they bring down a plentiful bag. Shows the daily life of the French Canadian inhabitants who find a hardy but wholesome existence on the island’s bountiful lowland.

results.title: Crane
results.creator_credit: Smith Street Films, Australian Film Commission and Margaret Anne Smith
results.brief_description: Set in the shipping terminal at Glebe Island, Sydney this short film explores the life and emotions of crane-operator Ron Watson (Robert Noble) who is facing a crisis situation both at home and at work. His job is demanding, often requiring shift-work and long hours. His marriage is falling apart because of his obsession with work and yet Ron seems unable to prevent the inevitable. And the job itself is a dangerous one requiring total focus and agility. Ron, like many of his co-workers on the water front, finally is confronted with the stresses around him and is forced to face the grim reality of his situation. Cast also includes Maya Potter, Joseph Petruzzi, Bob Hornery, Nicholas Flanagan. Original music by Colin Watson, Jim Conway with drums by Hanumandas and cinematography by Brendon Young.

results.title: Craig and Steven
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
An exploration of the concept of masculinity. Craig is a ballet student and Steve is an Australian rules footballer. They discuss their views of life.

results.title: Craftsmen young and old
results.brief_description: A screen magazine containing three items: “Man who makes monsters” Dinosaurs, towering reptiles and other prehistoric creatures, all made of concrete by John Kanerva, turn Calgary Park into a primeval zoo; “All the family carves” Visit to the home workshop of Andre Bourgault, famous French-Canadian sculptor, whose children are learning his craft; “Last of the totem makers” Chief Mango Martin and his son preserve in their carving of totem poles, a unique art of Canada’s Pacific coast Indians.

results.title: Craftsmart: christmas special
results.creator_credit: Phillip Harris, Lennox Television Productions and Kingwest Productions
results.brief_description: Great Australian Christmas decoration ideas, with Lena Williams who gives step by step instructions to make low cost, easy and highly decorative handicrafts including a traditional Christmas wreath and an Australian Christmas table setting complete with bread basket, napkins, salt and pepper shakers and an Australian centrepiece and bon bons.

results.title: Crafts of my province = Artisans de nouveau Brunswick [French language]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Marcel Martin
results.brief_description: A documentary on Canadian artisans from New Brunswick revolving around a sculptress and her husband who is a potter. Shows how they decorate, glaze and fire the pottery and each year open their house as a showroom to lovers of art. We meet their friends who are silversmiths and get inspiration from the sea and rocks and use stones to make jewellery. Also shows wool being dyed and woven into cloth for sale to the USA and overseas.
